before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"45k1o","text":"The protocol below describes the reagents, equipment, and specific experimental steps for using the spatial-ATAC-seq platform on fixed fresh frozen tissue slides. The 20 μm microfluidic channel width were designed and validated to provide spatial epigenomic profiles on human lymph note tissue sections. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8681s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4muft","text":"CRITICAL: Work in an RNase-free environment when the microfluidic device is not on the tissue slide. description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fn7db","text":"This protocol describes the use of Deterministic Barcoding in Tissue for spatial ATAC sequencing to construct an epigenome atlas of fixed fresh frozen human lymph node tissue samples. This approach uses a microfluidic-based method to introduce combinatorial DNA oligo barcodes directly to the cells in a tissue section fixed on a glass slide. This method spatially resolved genome-wide profiling of  transposase-accessible chromatin sequencing for chromatin accessibility.This technique does not directly resolve single cells but can achieve a near-single-cell resolution for spatial epigenomic analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fiq49","text":"Prepare a high-resolution computer-aided-design (CAD) file with the desired microfluidics chip design. A CAD file is also available in the link provided. (https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S2666166721002392-mmc4.zip)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":155,"length":71}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B0F31DE2385711ED9A700A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ars.els-cdn.com/content/image/1-s2.0-S2666166721002392-mmc4.zip"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60a9d","text":"Prepare chrome photomasks of the microfluidics chip by printing the high-resolution CAD files onto a glass substrate (Figure 1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sdv6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ziti5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bloid","text":"NOTE: We have outsourced this step (Front Range Photomask, USA). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34fsc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38hro","text":"Using these masks, prepare a replica mold as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA283187345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":185,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9io8s\",\"text\":\"Figure 1: Microfluidic Photomask Design. \",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":41}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"e0ffk\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"2h69n\",\"text\":\"(Left) AutoCAD design for the 20 micron-width fifty channel Chip-A and Chip-B. (Right) AutoCAD design for 10 micron-width channel Chip-A and Chip-B.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja59bxqg7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja57bxqg7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ja58bxqg7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja56bxqg7.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhc1g","text":"Start the process by cleaning a 4-inch silicon wafer with 100% acetone (Aldrich) and then 100% isopropanol (Aldrich), then dry with compressed air. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lvj5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnf5n","text":"NOTE: Acetone and isopropanol are mildly toxic. Use proper PPE when handling and discard waste in the appropriate containers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4ad9t","text":"Bake the wafer at 180°C for 10 min on a hot plate to dry it out.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"72lqs","text":"Use a spin coater to evenly spread SU-8 2010 photoresist (MicroChem) for 10 μm device or SU-8 2025 (MicroChem) for 25 μm and 50 μm device onto the wafer at 500 rpm for 5 seconds followed by 1100 rpm (10 μm device), 3500 rpm (25 μm device) or 1750 rpm (50 μm device) for 40 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"et82e","text":"Soft bake the wafer for 3 min at 65°C (25 μm and 50 μm device) and 4 min (10 μm device) or 6 min (25 μm and 50 μm device) at 95°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b45pm","text":"Expose the SU-8 on the wafer through the photomask using Mask Aligner with a dose of 150 mJ/cm2 UV.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vudd","text":"For the post exposure bake, bake the wafer for 1 min at 65°C (25 μm and 50 μm device) and 5 min (10 μm and 25 μm device) or 6 min (50 μm device) at 95°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n97u","text":"Develop the SU-8 for 4 min (10 μm and 25 μm device) or 5 min (50 μm device) in a bath of ∼50 mL SU-8 developer (MicroChem).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"174vn","text":"Rinse the wafer with 100% isopropanol and dry with compressed air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2u1t","text":"Perform a hard bake by baking the wafer for 10 min at 180°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aad42","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fjeb9","text":"CRITICAL: This process needs to be carried out in a microelectronics cleanroom. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bod1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0dc2","text":"Pause Point: The replica mold can now be stored and reused indefinitely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"51r0b","text":"Prepare the pattern and dimensions for the barcoding clamp and lysis clamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ak9oe","text":"Peel covering of acrylic sheet and place it in the laser cutting machine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"89f3p","text":"Select the program dimensions and cut two pieces for the top and bottom of the barcoding clamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dul9b","text":"Place the top blank piece into the laser cutter and select the pattern to cut out the four holes in the corner for the screws and nuts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"35gjf","text":"Remove cut-out scraps with a pipet tip or a similar pointed tool.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6aq2n","text":"Repeat steps 15 and 16 for the bottom blank piece.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3btf0","text":"Repeat steps 13 to 17 for the lysis clamp using the correct dimensions and pattern with an additional hole in the center of the top piece (Example shown in Figure 2). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqfpq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bniok","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ayrsw","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":null,"entityRanges":null,"data":{}},{"key":"4cu54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qm9b","text":"NOTE: The acrylic clamps can be reused indefinitely.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA47EC95345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":482,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"22l3i\",\"text\":\"Figure 2. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2g664","text":"Thoroughly mix polydimethylsiloxane (PDMS) elastomer base and curing agent (these come together) at a 10:1 ratio (See Figure 3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67v3k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnk7q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uouq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AA4ACF53345211EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":283,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"eu7kk\",\"text\":\"Figure 3: Step-by-step visual guide for making Chip-A and Chip-B.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":10}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure3.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja6hbxqg7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja6fbxqg7.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ja6gbxqg7.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/ja6ebxqg7.webp","width":550}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a798a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evgc6","text":"NOTE: Aim for a chip height of about 5mm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"o80b","text":"Place in a vacuum desiccator until all bubbles dissipate from the mixture about 30-60 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"eo6c5","text":"Cure in an oven at 65-70˚C for a minimum of 2 hours and up to overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av733","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8kcpk","text":"NOTE: Make sure to place on an even surface to prevent uneven curing!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fopae","text":"Cut out the cured device and hole punch each of the 50 inlets and outlets for the channels. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"au7qs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jafp","text":"NOTE: Cut both Chip-A and Chip-B in the approximate size of a glass slide. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hvnr","text":"NOTE: Make sure there are no PDMS pieces left in the inlets or outlets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1eh0e","text":"Thoroughly clean the surface of the device with scotch tape.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"acrd1","text":"Pour mixture in a container large enough to cut out two roughly 25x25x5mm PDMS pieces.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9aip8","text":"For the barcoding reservoir, cut out a 20x20mm piece in the center, barely large enough to surround the inlets of the chips when placed above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing the Microfluidic Device and reagent reservoirs
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7sugu","text":"For the lysis reservoir, depending on the device size used, cut out the center to barely surround the barcoded region of the tissue (1x1mm for the 10µm channel device, 2.5x2.5mm for the 25µm channel device). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2p54c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v8m6","text":"NOTE: The reservoirs are reusable. Thoroughly wash with 70% ethanol after each use.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"651gu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t50j","text":"CRITICAL: Be careful when cutting out the Chips A and B. Make sure not to cut across any patterned areas of the silicon wafer mold, otherwise it will need to be replaced and re-fabricated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epmkq","text":"Thoroughly mix the ligation linker 1 with each barcode A1-50 at and ligation linker 2 with each barcode B1-50 at a 1:1 ratio.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":56,"length":5},{"style":"sub","offset":105,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"a0rbk","text":"Place the 50 mixes in a thermal cycle and heat to 97˚C to anneal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4c2pr","text":"Slowly cool to room temperature at a rate of -0.1˚C/sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bd5n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bagv","text":"Store at -20˚C for up to 6 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5vusv","text":"25% sucrose overnight bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c8iid","text":"Embed in OCT frozen on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9t3a","text":"Section at ~7 µm thickness for the 25µm channel device and ~5 µm thickness for the 10 µm channel device onto Poly-L-lysine slides.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evuei","text":"Store slides at -80˚C for up to 6 months until use.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4spe1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2qd8k","text":"CRITICAL: Ensure that the tissue is sectioned as evenly as possible, otherwise the risk of cross-flow between the microfluidic channels will be increased. Tissue section should be placed at the center of a glass slide to the greatest extent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95ail","text":"Remove stored sections from the freezer and allow to warm to room temperature for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3brl8","text":"Clean sections by pipetting 2 mL of PBS-RI across the tissue.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e3ho","text":"If sections are not yet fixed, then fix here with 1 mL 0.2% PFA ,without methanol in 1X PBS,\n by applying on top of the tissue and incubate for 5 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"clhao","text":"Wash the slides with 1 mL of PBS for 1 minute and then dip the slide in a 50 mL falcon tube with DI water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f6tjn","text":"Dry the section with gentle air flow.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67reh","text":"Take a full pre-scan image of the section at the desired optical resolution (Figure 4A). {"blocks":[{"key":"8e7pq","text":"Aspirate remaining barcode A mixture from inlets/outlets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9u8t1","text":"Clean the channels by flushing 1X NEB buffer 3.1 with 1% Enzymatics RNase Inhibitor for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4neu","text":"Attach Chip-B centered on the tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7t220","text":"Introduce final barcode B mixture to the tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"abhib","text":"Clean the channels with wash buffer for 10 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9l0ad","text":"Place in the humidified chamber and tightly wrap the chamber with parafilm and incubate at 55˚C for 2 hours.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k5ja","text":"The cDNA is purified and bound to Dynabeads™ MyOne™ Streptavidin C1 beads in this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8j0ro","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vtsh","text":"Prepare 40 µL DynabeadsTM MyOneTM Streptavidin C1 beads (Thermofisher) per sub-library. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p5qq","text":"Purify lysate following the DNA Clean \u0026 Concentrator with Zymo-spin IC Columns (RPI Research Products) protocol. Use 100 µL water to elute DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dp1l9","text":"Add 100 µL of resuspended DynabeadsTM MyOneTM Streptavidin C1 magnetic beads to each lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6uef7","text":"Rotate at 30 RPM and room temperature for 60 min for binding to occur.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1ifdp","text":"Wash beads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8bg5c","text":"Add10 μl of unloaded Tn5 transposome (Diagnode Tagmentase) to the mixture of  oligo A/oligo Rev and oligo B/oligo Rev.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6785f","text":"After vortexing the mixture briefly, incubate the tube at 23 ºC for 30 minutes in a thermocycler. {"blocks":[{"key":"egeda","text":"Load the slide into a lysis clamping device and tighten screws as much as possible by hand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"83f53","text":"Image the lysis chip on the ROI using a 10x objective lens.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f40t9","text":"Add approximately 50- 100μL of the reverse crosslinking lysis solution into the lysis chip. CRITICAL STEP Make sure to record the volume added of the lysis solution for the remaining steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dmhbg","text":"Cover the ROI hole using parafilm and load the slide into a humidifying chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqrmd","text":"Incubate tissue the slide with PDMS reservoir and Lysis Solution at 58 ºC for 2 hours to reverse formaldehyde crosslinks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqtn5","text":"After incubation, collect the lysate in a 200μL PCR tube (or 1.5mL tube) and seal the tube with parafilm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8t82m","text":"Incubate the lysate at 65 ºC with rotation overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"tbrj","text":"Transfer the clear supernatant to a new tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5op51","text":"Place the tubes back on the magnet and incubate until the liquid is fully clear.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3bp0","text":"Incubate the tubes at room temperature for at least 10 min to elute the cDNA off the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22ind","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnet and resuspend the beads in 15-20 µL of PCR-grade water or elution buffer depending on downstream application.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6v8tb","text":"Repeat steps 70-75.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"20kp6","text":"Carefully remove and discard the ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f4p93","text":"Incubate the tubes at room temperature for at least 30 sec.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"btr9n","text":"Carefully remove and discard the supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9ckhg","text":"Keep the tubes on the magnet and add 200 µL of 80% ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"66d9c","text":"Mix thoroughly by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qgmp","text":"Perform a 1X SPRI purification by adding 45uL Ampure XP beads to the sample.  Mix thoroughly by pipetting or vortexing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6rebm","text":"Send the samples for 100 million reads (30 Gb) and 150 bp paired end sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"m0hn","text":"Transfer the two filtered sequences from Step 125 to Cell Ranger ATAC format (10x Genomics)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"v7r1","text":"Align the filtered reads to the reference genome (e.g., mouse reference (mm10) or human reference (GRCh38) genome)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1iofn","text":"Adjust the reads for the Tn5 offset and generate an HTML report with per-base quality scores from which the overall sequencing quality of the library can be inferred. This step provides adjusted reads to correct the Tn5 enzyme’s tendency to insert sequencing adapters from true chromatin accessibility sites at positions offset.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2qqh","text":"Perform peak calling and generate the number of Tn5 insertion events and fragments, generating a matrix with spatial barcodes. {"blocks":[{"key":"emoh2","text":"The Snakemake workflow management system (v5.28.0) pretreatment pipeline was created and used for preprocessing data, including trimming and alignment, and it is publicly available on GitHub at https://github.com/dyxmvp/Spatial_ATAC-seq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":194,"length":42}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B6B8A62F908E11EF9F100A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/dyxmvp/Spatial_ATAC-seq"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65rjd","text":"Repeat step 68 PCR protocol to amplify the remaining product with the cycles determined in step 69","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
